option.name: conversationsContainer
option.value: {"conversationsMapping":{"pschat.chat.completion":[{"id":"416b5530-c343-4b11-9b00-292caf950ada","messages":[{"prompt":"","selectedFiles":null,"id":"0e66f42d-4603-4673-be37-48fee8b538cd","promptLibrary":null,"response":"Successfully signed in to Publicis Sapient as Prakhar Vishnoi.","userMessage":null,"serpResults":null,"images":null,"additionalSvgContent":null,"toolStages":[],"timestamp":"2025-11-27T13:03:56.185614700Z","documentDataList":null,"listOfFiles":null,"workspaceReferencesFileList":null},{"prompt":"load selected pom as maven","selectedFiles":[],"id":"28e7b7db-2059-4ccc-88e4-81649d5cc5c7","promptLibrary":null,"response":"To load the selected [pom.xml](C:/Users/pravishn2/Documents/Dev/Microservices/section2/cards/pom.xml) as a Maven project, follow these steps: 1. **Open a Terminal or Command Prompt**: Navigate to the directory containing the `pom.xml` file. 2. **Run Maven Command**: Use the following command to load the project and ensure all dependencies are resolved: ```shell mvn clean install ``` 3. **Verify the Build**: Ensure that the build completes successfully without errors. This will compile the project, run tests, and package the application. ### Explanation - **`mvn clean install`**: This command cleans the project, compiles the source code, runs tests, and installs the package into the local repository, making it available for other projects on your machine. - **Dependencies**: The `pom.xml` file specifies various dependencies like Spring Boot starters, H2 database, Lombok, and SpringDoc for OpenAPI. These will be resolved and downloaded during the build process. - **Java Version**: Ensure that your system's Java version is compatible with the version specified in the `pom.xml` (`21`). If you encounter any issues during the build, please provide the error messages for further assistance. Sources-Repos/Files: - Selected context","userMessage":null,"serpResults":null,"images":[],"additionalSvgContent":[],"toolStages":[],"timestamp":"2025-11-27T13:03:57.713320600Z","documentDataList":[],"listOfFiles":["cards/pom.xml"],"workspaceReferencesFileList":null},{"prompt":"but why intellij has not autodetedcted it","selectedFiles":[],"id":"6364bfaf-055a-415a-a88c-ba45ce38bc9e","promptLibrary":null,"response":"IntelliJ IDEA might not have auto-detected the [pom.xml](C:/Users/pravishn2/Documents/Dev/Microservices/section2/cards/pom.xml) as a Maven project due to a few common reasons: 1. **Project Structure**: Ensure that the project is opened correctly in IntelliJ as a Maven project. Sometimes, if the project is opened as a simple directory, IntelliJ might not recognize it as a Maven project. 2. **Maven Plugin**: Verify that the Maven plugin is enabled in IntelliJ. Go to `File > Settings > Plugins` and ensure that the Maven plugin is installed and enabled. 3. **Project Configuration**: Check if the project is configured as a Maven project. You can do this by right-clicking on the project root in the Project Explorer, selecting `Add Framework Support`, and then choosing `Maven`. 4. **IDE Caching Issues**: Sometimes, IntelliJ's cache can cause issues with project detection. Try invalidating caches by going to `File > Invalidate Caches / Restart`. If these steps do not resolve the issue, please ensure that the [pom.xml](C:/Users/pravishn2/Documents/Dev/Microservices/section2/cards/pom.xml) is correctly formatted and that there are no errors in the file itself. Sources-Repos/Files: - Selected context","userMessage":null,"serpResults":null,"images":[],"additionalSvgContent":[],"toolStages":[],"timestamp":"2025-11-27T13:04:42.980654900Z","documentDataList":[],"listOfFiles":["cards/pom.xml"],"workspaceReferencesFileList":null},{"prompt":"I am not getting add framework support option","selectedFiles":[],"id":"d0c16827-08d3-47a3-92aa-5d76ad4bff84","promptLibrary":null,"response":"If you're not seeing the "Add Framework Support" option in IntelliJ IDEA, it might be due to the project not being recognized as a Maven project. Here are some steps to troubleshoot and resolve this issue: 1. **Check Project Structure**: - Ensure that the [pom.xml](C:/Users/pravishn2/Documents/Dev/Microservices/section2/cards/pom.xml) is located at the root of your project directory. - Open the project in IntelliJ by selecting the directory containing the `pom.xml`. 2. **Enable Maven Plugin**: - Go to `File > Settings > Plugins` and ensure the Maven plugin is installed and enabled. 3. **Re-import the Project**: - Right-click on the `pom.xml` file in the Project Explorer and select `Add as Maven Project`. - Alternatively, go to `View > Tool Windows > Maven` and click the refresh button to re-import the project. 4. **Invalidate Caches**: - Go to `File > Invalidate Caches / Restart` and select `Invalidate and Restart`. This can resolve issues related to IntelliJ's cache. 5. **Check for Errors in pom.xml**: - Open the [pom.xml](C:/Users/pravishn2/Documents/Dev/Microservices/section2/cards/pom.xml) and ensure there are no syntax errors or unresolved dependencies. If these steps do not resolve the issue, please ensure that the IntelliJ IDEA version you are using supports the Java version specified in your `pom.xml` (`21`). If you have further questions or need additional help, feel free to ask! Sources-Repos/Files: - Selected context","userMessage":null,"serpResults":null,"images":[],"additionalSvgContent":[],"toolStages":[],"timestamp":"2025-11-27T13:07:13.434002400Z","documentDataList":[],"listOfFiles":["cards/pom.xml"],"workspaceReferencesFileList":null},{"prompt":"in my root directory there are 3 projects one coming as maven while other two are not recognised. I have opened the root diesctory","selectedFiles":[],"id":"af703500-b4de-47ce-a8fe-0d887aa04000","promptLibrary":null,"response":"To resolve the issue where only one of your projects is recognized as a Maven project in IntelliJ IDEA, follow these steps: 1. **Check `pom.xml` Presence**: Ensure that each of the projects has its own `pom.xml` file at the root of its directory. This file is essential for IntelliJ to recognize a project as a Maven project. 2. **Open Each Project Separately**: - Instead of opening the root directory containing all three projects, try opening each project individually in IntelliJ. This can help IntelliJ detect the `pom.xml` files correctly. 3. **Re-import as Maven Projects**: - For the projects not recognized, right-click on their respective `pom.xml` files in the Project Explorer and select `Add as Maven Project`. 4. **Check IntelliJ Settings**: - Ensure that the Maven plugin is enabled in IntelliJ. Go to `File > Settings > Plugins` and verify that the Maven plugin is active. 5. **Invalidate Caches**: - Go to `File > Invalidate Caches / Restart` and select `Invalidate and Restart`. This can help resolve any caching issues that might prevent project recognition. 6. **Project Structure**: - Ensure that the directory structure of each project is correct and that the `pom.xml` is not nested within subdirectories that might prevent IntelliJ from detecting it. If these steps do not resolve the issue, please check for any errors in the `pom.xml` files of the unrecognized projects, as syntax errors can also prevent recognition. If you need further assistance, feel free to ask! Sources-Repos/Files: - Selected context","userMessage":null,"serpResults":null,"images":[],"additionalSvgContent":[],"toolStages":[],"timestamp":"2025-11-27T13:09:22.452637600Z","documentDataList":[],"listOfFiles":["cards/pom.xml"],"workspaceReferencesFileList":null}],"clientCode":"pschat.chat.completion","model":"PSChat","provider":"LionChatRag","providerModel":"gpt-4o","createdOn":[2025,11,26,11,11,57,202633600],"updatedOn":[2025,11,27,18,39,36,214320100],"discardTokenLimit":false,"chatId":"29f02063-5f0a-4d3f-934d-472cafafece5","chatTabName":"DEFAULT","chatType":"STANDARD"}]}}
